Class Main

java.lang.Object
Main
public class Main extends Object
Calls main() function, which calls drawMainApplication.
Since:
22
Author:
Cailean Bernard

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Calls drawMainApplication(), which draws the GUI.
      Parameters:
      args - - An array of strings passed as arguments
      Since:
      22

    • drawMainApplication

      public static void drawMainApplication()
      Draws the GUI elements. Each GUI element is a JPanel, which holds other JPanels. There are outer elements, which hold the title bar, console, player's hand, and the gameplay area. Each of these areas is further broken down into several other components.
      Since:
      22

    • drawSplash

      public static void drawSplash()
      Draws a splash screen for 3 seconds.
      Since:
      22

    • addCardsToHand

      static void addCardsToHand(JPanel area, boolean horizontal, boolean visible, GridBagConstraints gbc)
      Method to add cards to hand.
      Parameters:
      area - - The JPanel to add the cards to
      horizontal - - If the JPanel is displaying horizontally or not. If true, panel is horizontal, if false, panel is vertical. This changes which card slices we are displaying for that user's hand.
      visible - - Changes if the card displayed is a card back (hidden) or a card face (visible). The only time we display card faces in this method is for when we are rendering cards in the user's hand.
      gbc - - The GridBagConstraints needed to add the cards to vertical hands.
      Since:
      22

    • addConsoleMessage

      static void addConsoleMessage(JTextPane textBox, User user, String message)
      Temporary method (will be refactored) to add a message to the chat display. If the user is "console" (id: 0) then their text is displayed in red. Else, all messages are in black. Writes a string passed to it to the StyledDocument of the passed JTextPane, and displays the passed User's name.
      Parameters:
      textBox - - The JTextBox to write to
      user - - The user writing to the text box
      message - - The String being written
      Since:
      22

    • getMyFont

      static Font getMyFont(String path)
      Fetches the custom font specified at "path" and returns the font to be used in setFont() functions.
      Parameters:
      path - - The path to the font.
      Returns:
      Font - The Font returned from the specified path, after it has been located.
      Since:
      22
